|eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |oui = <!-- Wireless OUI -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43602;BCM43602KMLG, TN1418 P11, 379203 65 3A W; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad1ac = 1300 |nqam1 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43602;BCM43602KMLG, TN1418 P11, 379203 65 3A W; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 1300 |nqam2 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
|rad3chip1 = Broadcom;BCM43602;BCM43602KMLG, TN1418 P11, 379203 65 3A W; |rad3oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad3_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad3txchains = 3 |rad3rxchains = 3 |rad3sstreams = 3 |rad3stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam3 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000, --> |rad3n = 450 |rad3g = 54 |rad3b = 11 |rad3freq = 2.4 |rad3correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad3cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This is yet another artificially limited Costco exclusive model. In this case, the R7900 is a [[Netgear R8000|R8000]] with 256QAM disabled on the three stream 2.4GHz radio limiting its maximum theoretical speed to 450Mbps instead of 600Mbps. Also, the USB 2.0 port was removed for the R7900.
<small> While not really represented well in the infobox, this is a tri-radio device - all radios (2x 5GHz [an+ac], 1x 2.4GHz [bgn]) used are BCM43602 (''FullMAC'') is supported in the mainline '''Linux''' kernel by [[brcmfmac]] </small> {{See also|Netgear R8000|Foxconn}}
